posts.title: Camping and Starbucks Venti - That's the Life!
posts.content:
CATEGORY: diary

Weekend camping was tough, but also really relaxing.

After packing up all the gear and sweating like crazy, I was seriously craving something cold.

So, on the way home, I stopped by Starbucks and got a Venti iced Americano - perfect!

Isn't this why we go camping? Back to work after the holiday, let's do our best!

posts.title: Myeongdong's Ham Bomb Budae-jjigae! Seriously a Rice Thief
posts.content:
Hey everyone, my Myeongdong office worker lunch ë§›ì§‘ (mat-jip - good eats) exploration is back! Today, I went to a place famous for their Ham Bomb Budae-jjigae (Korean army stew with ham and sausage).

Look at all that ham in the picture! This is for two people, and the ham is seriously substantial, right? I was also touched by how generously they included the rolled egg. And they give you a big bowl of rice. Seriously generous!

Honestly, a lot of budae-jjigae places use cheap ham, right? But you can tell right away here. It's not that typical cheap ham flavor. Because the ham itself is tasty, the soup also tastes deep and rich.

They had a few other lunch menu options besides budae-jjigae, but I highly recommend the budae-jjigae! I remember the price being pretty good too. Considering Myeongdong prices, it's a great value!

The atmosphere is just a normal restaurant. It's not super fancy or anything, but it's a good place to eat comfortably! If you want a hearty meal in Myeongdong, give this place a try. You won't regret it!

posts.title: Gwangcheon Handmade Noodle Honest Review: A Myeongdong Office Worker's Food Trip?
posts.content:
Hey everyone! I'm an office worker in Myeongdong.

Today, during the holiday, I took a big step and went all the way from Myeongdong to Gwangcheon in Chungnam just to eat some Kalguksu (Korean knife-cut noodle soup). Whoosh!

To be honest, it's not like a super amazing restaurant that you absolutely MUST visit.

Um... it just tastes like a clean and simple Kalguksu?! That's pretty much it.
The broth is refreshing, but it's not something that's super impressive or anything.

Looking at the menu, they also sell Suyuk Gukbap (Pork Soup with Rice). It's 10,000 won! Kalguksu is 8,000 won!

I wonder if it was a bit too much to come all the way to Gwangcheon just for Kalguksu, but it was nice to get some fresh air.

In conclusion, don't have too high expectations, and visit when you're craving a clean and simple Kalguksu!

Personally, I recommend the Taean Seobu Market Kalguksu more. I'll post about that later. ~

From Myeongdong to Gwangcheon... hmmm... ğŸ¤”

posts.title: Myeongdong Office Workers' Lunch Pick! Garlic Gopchang Tteokbokki
posts.content:
Hi everyone, Myeongdong office workers! It's your 40s editor who's always looking forward to lunchtime.

Today, I finally went to this tteokbokki place that I've only heard rumors about!

The star of the day is this tteokbokki restaurant famous for its 'Garlic Gopchang Tteokbokki'. Just like many restaurants in Myeongdong, you need to pay first here.

Of course, the signature menu is Garlic Gopchang Tteokbokki!

The garlic aroma is seriously amazing. The gopchang (small intestine) is also chewy and goes so well with the tteokbokki sauce. The tteok (rice cake) is long, and it's fun to cut it yourself. You can even eat it whole if you want! I really loved the chewy texture of the tteok.

The price is a little high for tteokbokki, but I think it's worth it because it includes gopchang and the portion is pretty generous. The vibe is like a super hip tteokbokki place? It's perfect for chatting with friends while you eat.

If you're looking for a great tteokbokki place in Myeongdong, I totally recommend this place! You definitely have to try the Garlic Gopchang Tteokbokki. You won't regret it!

posts.title: Myeongdong Real Local Baekban (Korean Meal Set), A Hidden Gem Without a Sign!
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch

Hi Myeongdong office workers!
I'm a 40-something office worker who always looks forward to lunchtime.

Today, I'm going to introduce a hidden Korean food restaurant that only real locals in Myeongdong know about. I wanted to keep it a secret... but I decided to share it with you all! ğŸ˜‰

Today's star is! (Drum roll) A humble baekban place without even a sign.
Don't judge it by its appearance.
There aren't many places in Myeongdong where you can eat such a filling meal for this price. ğŸ‘

You can pretty much eat any common Korean dishes here.

As for the taste... honestly, it's a bit on the salty side.
But, it's not overly salty or spicy, so I enjoyed it. 
(Just so you know, I usually prefer my food a little bland!)

The atmosphere is totally like an old-school baekban restaurant.
Don't expect fancy interior design. ğŸ˜…
But, the advantage is that you can have a hearty meal in a friendly atmosphere.

In conclusion! If you're looking for a Myeongdong local baekban place with great value, I highly recommend it!
Have a filling lunch here today and have a great afternoon! ğŸ’ª

posts.title: Myeongdong Sundae Soup: A Real ë§›ì§‘ Approved by a 40s Office Worker!
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch

Hi everyone, especially those working in Myeongdong! I'm a 40-something office worker who lives for lunchtime. 

Today, I'm introducing a famous sundae soup restaurant in Myeongdong. I thought I was early, but there were already 4 teams waiting! Guess it's really a popular place. 

The menu is super simple: Regular sundae soup and Special! Doesn't that scream ë§›ì§‘? And they're smart - they don't sell alcohol before 2 PM. So, if you're craving a daytime drink, come after 2! 

Finally, my sundae soup arrived! The hot broth is amazing. It's the perfect dish for a cold day. There's so much meat inside, it's really filling. The broth is rich, the sundae is chewy, and the taste is perfect. Can't find anything to complain about! 

I think the price was pretty good too. I remember the sundae soup being around 8,000 won. (Now 10,000 won) Considering Myeongdong prices, that's a steal! This is an honest review, paid for with my own money. 

If you're ever craving hot soup in Myeongdong, definitely give this place a try! You won't regret it.

posts.title: Hunan Cuisine in the Middle of Myeongdong? Hmm...
posts.content:
CATEGORY: diary

I went to Myeongdong for lunch and was totally surprised. 

Guess what? They're opening a Hunan Province (China) local cuisine restaurant in a place that's under construction. 

Myeongdong is really something. 

You can find literally anything here. 

But... I wonder if Korean people will like it? It's none of my business, but I just got curious. Well, if it does well, that's great, and if it doesn't... oh well. That's life, right?

posts.title: Myeongdong [Darakbang]: Kimchi Kalguksu for â‚©7,500!
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch

Hey everyone, it's your Myeongdong office worker food explorer!

Today, I'm going to introduce one of my favorite snack bars. It's cozy like a small attic ('Darakbang' in Korean), but it's like a hidden gem.

The place is called... Darakbang... but actually, it's located in the basement. ğŸ˜‰ Can you believe you can get Kimchi Kalguksu for only â‚©7,500 in the heart of Myeongdong? With today's prices, it's a super generous deal.

The Kimchi Kalguksu soup is spicy and refreshing, and the noodles are chewy and delicious. I think they even make their own kimchi! ğŸ‘ Although it's a snack bar, they also have curry rice, so it feels a bit like a Korean diner.

The curry rice might seem ordinary, but it's surprisingly addictive. It has that comforting taste like your mom's homemade curry. ğŸ˜‹ It's a great place for eating alone and perfect for a quick lunch.

If you're looking for an affordable and tasty snack bar in Myeongdong, you should definitely check it out! You won't regret it. ğŸ˜Š

posts.title: Craving That Cinnamon Vibe
posts.content:
CATEGORY: diary

I'm really craving a Kozel Dark today.

A can of beer on the way home from work would be perfect.

But then I remembered I'm out of cinnamon powder.

I definitely need to buy some cinnamon powder tomorrow... I'm gonna sprinkle a lot on my Kozel Dark and enjoy it.

Anyone who knows this taste is probably in their late 40s like me, maybe.

The scent of cinnamon makes life's bitterness sweet, can't miss out on that. It's so good.

posts.title: Myeongdong Vibes! Live Cafe Tempting Day Drinkers
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch

Okay, so today I'm gonna introduce you to a place with amazing vibes â€“ it's a live cafe and bar! 
It's Friday night, but I can't drink... ğŸ˜­ (tears)

"No-alcohol Friday night" is kinda sad, but I gotta heal with the atmosphere! The interior design is super artsy and I totally loved it.

The fact that they have live music performances is really attractive. Listening to music with a drink in the evening would be so stress-relieving! (But I'm not drinking...)
I definitely wanna visit again at night and have a drink next time! ğŸ»

If you're looking for a place with a good vibe in Myeongdong, I totally recommend this place! 
It's good for both lunch and dinner, so give it a try. ğŸ˜‰

posts.title: Myeongdong McDonald's: Coleslaw & Iced Americano?! ğŸ”
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch

Lunch time, what should I eat today~ ğŸ¤”

I came to McDonald's after a really long time! ğŸ”ğŸŸ It's so popular, maybe because it's a global food. McDonald's is always crowded everywhere, I guess.

Instead of the usual Coke and fries, I tried something different today! ğŸ¥¤ I got coleslaw instead of fries, and an iced Americano instead of Coke. I kind of feel healthier? ğŸ˜

McDonald's, well, it tastes like what everyone knows! ğŸ‘ Sometimes I crave that familiar taste. It's cheap and easy to eat alone, so I come here often.

If you want a quick lunch in Myeongdong, McDonald's is a good choice. Especially try the coleslaw & iced Americano combo like me! You can experience a different McDonald's. ğŸ˜‰

I'll be back with another Myeongdong ë§›ì§‘ (delicious restaurant) next time! ğŸ™‹â€â™€ï¸

posts.title: Free Burger at Myeongdong McDonald's - So Delicious!ğŸ˜‹
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch

Hey everyone! Myeongdong office worker here. I'm back with another delicious lunch adventure! Today I went to a really special place(?).

I bet you already know from the picture, right? It's McDonald's! ğŸ¤£ I think it might be the most popular McDonald's in the whole country. Since it's right in the middle of Myeongdong... ahem.

Today's order was the Bacon Tomato Deluxe Burger set!
I added coleslaw and also got an iced Americano.

The burger was sweet for my taste, the coleslaw was tangy, and the iced Americano... was a little small! LOL. But it tasted amazing because it was a free burger.

Honestly, you all know what McDonald's tastes like, but it's perfect for a quick and cheap lunch in Myeongdong! I should visit Myeongdong McDonald's once in a while. ğŸ˜‰

posts.title: Another Beer Today. Different Carlsberg This Time.
posts.content:
CATEGORY: diary

On my way home from work, I found myself in front of the beer fridge, like always.

Instead of my usual beer, I felt like trying something different today.

Carlsberg? It's the Danish Royal beer, right? I guess it feels kinda fancy, or maybe that's just me.

The moment I opened the can, a slightly bitter yet refreshing scent tickled my nose.

Well, I worked hard today. This is like a small reward for myself. Gotta keep going tomorrow!

posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch

Hi everyone! I'm a 40-something office worker in Myeongdong, always on the hunt for great lunch spots. 

Today, I'm introducing a place I've already visited twice this week! That means it's definitely perfect for my taste, right?

There's usually a little wait during lunchtime, but you can save time by deciding what to eat while looking at the menu! They have a variety of noodles and rice dishes, and the prices aren't too bad considering Myeongdong prices. Today, after thinking about what to eat, I decided to definitely order the Xiaolongbao, which I enjoyed last time! Oh, I was so focused on eating that I forgot to take pictures. ã… ã…  It's already in my stomach, what can I do... I guess I'll have to eat it again next time.

Today, I ordered the roast duck rice bowl along with the Xiaolongbao. The glossy roast duck was piled high on top of the rice, and the visuals were perfect! The sweet and savory sauce and the tender roast duck were a fantastic combination. I scraped every last grain of rice clean.

There are many people eating alone today, and it's also good to come with colleagues and order several dishes to share. The clean atmosphere is also a plus, making it a comfortable place to eat during lunchtime! If you want to have a delicious lunch in Myeongdong, give it a try!

posts.title: Scored a Carlsberg Liverpool Glass Set! This is why I love collecting stuff
posts.content:
On my way home from work, I did my usual thing and opened the CU app... and bam! Carlsberg Liverpool glass package pre-order! As soon as I saw it, I knew I had to buy it. I've been a Liverpool fan (a Kopite!) for over 10 years, so there's no way I could pass this up.

What else is there to life, right? Chilling with a beer after work, looking at my favorite team's merch, that's what keeps me going. My bank account might be empty, but my heart is full! It's magic!

Sometimes, these little joys are the reason I go to work. Long live my hobby! Long live Carlsberg! Let's go Liverpool, win the league!

posts.title: Myeongdong Lunch Automation, Finally Did It!
posts.content:
CATEGORY: diary

I finally completed my automation pipeline for Myeongdong local lunch blog posts! Can you feel the power of vibe coding? Now, just a few pictures and a sentence or two, and bam! A post is done. 

Before, I had to open map apps, take pictures of the menu, compare prices... just thinking about it makes me shiver. Trying to squeeze it in after work wasn't easy. Now, the AI does it for me, and it's so convenient. 

Of course, there are probably still many things to improve. But isn't this why we code? (If you have a lunch appointment in Myeongdong... hit me up... gotta collect more data... cough cough)

posts.title: KEPCO Cafeteria: A Delicious Meal for Only 6,000 Won! ğŸ˜‹
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch
RESTAURANT_ADDRESS: ì„œìš¸íŠ¹ë³„ì‹œ ì¤‘êµ¬ ì„ì§€ë¡œ2ê°€ 199-4
RESTAURANT_PLACE_ID: 
VISIT_COUNT: 1

Lunchtime! Where should I go today? ğŸ¤” I'm tired of eating the same food every day, so I decided to try the KEPCO cafeteria! ğŸ¤­ I've heard rumors that the food here is really good. And I found out that outsiders can eat here too! ğŸ˜

It's located on the first basement floor of the Korea Electric Power Corporation building. And guess what? There's a model of old Seoul in the lobby on the first floor! ğŸ˜² It was fun looking at the miniatures. (But the scale seems a little off... ğŸ¤£)

Okay, finally got my meal ticket! Only 6,000 won for sea tangle rice, soybean paste soup, seaweed, kimchi, salad, and flat meat patty! Isn't that awesome?! ğŸ‘ The sea tangle rice was chewy and delicious, and the soybean paste soup was perfect. The side dishes were also neat and good!ğŸ’¯

Honestly, I didn't expect much from a company cafeteria, but it was surprisingly spacious and clean. There were a lot of people eating alone, so I could enjoy my meal without feeling awkward. ğŸ˜Œ However, it gets super crowded during lunchtime! I recommend going before 12 o'clock! ğŸ™

In conclusion! This quality for 6,000 won is a total steal! I'll definitely come here often. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable lunch in Myeongdong! ğŸ¤—

posts.title: Myeongdong Dimdimsum: 10% Off! Wonton Noodle Soup Review
posts.content:
CATEGORY: lunch
RESTAURANT_ADDRESS: B1 Floor, Noon Square, 83-5 Myeongdong 2(i)-ga, Jung-gu, Seoul
RESTAURANT_PLACE_ID: dimdimsum
VISIT_COUNT: 1

As a 40-something office worker who's always thinking about where to go for lunch, that's me! Today, I went to 'Dimdimsum' in Myeongdong, which is famous for its dim sum. Guess what? I got a 10% discount coupon! I couldn't miss this chance, so I rushed over there. ğŸ˜

Thanks to the coupon, I ordered some dishes that I usually find a bit pricey. This is what I call a small flex, right? ğŸ˜† Dimdimsum tastes almost exactly like the dim sum I had in Hong Kong, so it's perfect for when I'm missing Hong Kong. The atmosphere is clean and spacious, making it easy to have a comfortable lunch.

I ordered the Wonton Noodle Soup and Shrimp and Chives Dumplings! The Wonton Noodle Soup had a really refreshing broth and the noodles were so chewy, I slurped it all up. The Shrimp and Chives Dumplings were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside - so delicious! But be careful, the freshly made dumplings are super hot. ğŸ”¥ I almost burned my mouthâ€¦ ğŸ˜…

The prices are a bit high, but the 10% discount made it much more affordable. I recommend Dimdimsum if you want to eat dim sum in Myeongdong! Especially when you have a discount coupon, definitely go. ğŸ¤© It's near Myeongdong Station, so the location is great! I fully recharged with delicious dim sum during lunch! Look forward to my next restaurant exploration~ ğŸ˜Š

posts.title: Apink, Still There Like Time Stopped
posts.content:
Apink is still performing? Wow, that's surprising! 

Seeing them on Open Concert right now, it's really them. 

I started reminiscing about the old days without even realizing it... guess I'm getting old. 

Time flies so fast, but it's amazing and even makes me feel thankful that someone is still the same as they were back then. 

Thanks to them, I had a nice trip down memory lane. Gotta live my life to the fullest today too!
